snippet: Alice Walton is said to have purchased a Warhol during the fall auctions; a MoMA exhibition focuses on studio photography.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Alice L Walton, Walmart heiress who founded Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art in Bentonville, Ark, is anonymous buyer of high-profile artworks; A World of Its Own: Photographic Practices in the Studio is first show organized by Quentin Bajac as chief photography curator at Museum of Modern Art; North Dakota Museum of Art considers buying James Rosenquist painting Through the Eye of the Needle to the Anvil, currently being exhibited in honor of Rosenquist's 80th birthday.
lead_paragraph: Alice Walton is said to have purchased a Warhol during the fall auctions; a MoMA exhibition focuses on studio photography.

headline.main: A Warhol Is Said to Be Bought by a Walton
headline.print_headline: A Buyer’s Identity Starts To Come Into Focus
